sect1.title: Introduction
sect1.para: &app; enables you to convert the name of a file, or the contents of a plain-text file, from a legacy character encoding to UTF-8 encoding.

note.para: The default internal character encoding in the Sun Java Desktop System is UTF-8 encoding, and the default locale is the UTF-8 locale. If not converted, files with legacy character encoding are displayed as meaningless text.

sect2.title: To Start &appname;
sect2.para: You can start &app; in the following ways:

listitem.para: Click Launch, then choose ApplicationsUtilitiesFile System Examiner.
Execute the following command: fsexam

sect2.title: When You Start &appname;
sect2.para: When you start &app;, the following window is displayed:
The &app; window contains the following elements:

listitem.para: The menus on the menubar contain all of the commands that you need to work with files in &app;.
The display area displays the contents of the current directory.
The statusbar displays information about current &app; activity.

sect2.para: When you right-click in the &app; window, the application displays a popup menu. The popup menu contains the most common commands.
This manual documents functionality from the menubar.

sect2.title: To Select a File or Directory
sect2.para: Choose FileOpen, then select the file or directory whose character encoding you want to change.
If you select a directory, all of the files and subdirectories in that directory are displayed in the display area.

sect2.title: To Convert the Name of a File or Directory
sect2.para: Perform the following steps:

listitem.para: Select the file or directory, as described in .
Choose EditConvert Filename.
By default, the File System Examiner name conversion dialog is displayed. For information on how to display or hide the File System Examiner name conversion dialog, see .
The File System Examiner name conversion dialog displays a list of character encodings that &app; can use to convert the filename.
Select an encoding, then click OK.

sect2.para: If &app; successfully renames the file, the statusbar displays the name of the legacy character encoding.
If the conversion fails, the statusbar displays an error message.

sect2.title: To Convert the Contents of a File
sect2.para: Perform the following steps:

listitem.para: Select the file, as described in .
Choose EditConvert Content.
The File System Examiner content conversion window displays the converted contents of the file.
To accept the conversion and overwrite the original file with the converted contents, click OK.
To cancel the conversion, close the File System Examiner content conversion window.

sect2.para: If &app; successfully converts the file contents, the statusbar displays the following text: File content - convert from original_encoding
If the conversion fails, the statusbar displays an error message.

note.para: &app; can only convert the contents of a plain-text file. &app; uses the file command to check whether the current file is a plain-text file. If the file command output is not available, &app; displays the following error message: popen error, please try again

sect2.title: To Preview the Contents of a File
sect2.para: Perform the following steps:

listitem.para: Select the file, as described in .
Choose EditPreview Content.

sect2.para: If &app; successfully previews the file contents, a popup window displays the first part of the file. Click on the popup window to close the window.
If the preview fails, the statusbar displays an error message.

sect2.title: To Undo the Last Action
sect2.para: Choose EditUndo.

sect2.title: To Restore the Original File
sect2.para: Perform the following steps:

listitem.para: Select the file, as described in .
Choose EditRestore Original File.

sect2.para: &app; restores the original file contents in a file with the original filename.

sect2.title: To Display the Report Pane
sect2.para: Choose ViewReport Pane.
The report pane displays the directory name, and a list of converted files with corresponding legacy character encoding names.
At the beginning of each line, [X] indicates the action that &app; performed, as follows:
To hide the report pane, choose ViewReport Pane again.

sect1.title: Preferences
sect1.para: To configure &app;, choose EditPreferences. The File System Examiner preferences dialog is displayed.

listitem.para: Select the Recursive Mode option to specify that &app; converts the names of all files and subdirectories in the selected directory.

note.para: &app; does not recursively convert the contents of a directory.

listitem.para: Select the Automatic Conversion option to specify that &app; uses the first suitable legacy character encoding in the Encode list to convert the names of files and subdirectories to UTF-8 encoding. If you do not select this option, &app; displays the File System Examiner name conversion dialog, as described in .
Displays a list of legacy character encodings available for the current language. Click Up to move an encoding up the list. Click Down to move an encoding down the list.
